The developers posted an update on Steam to say that the scheduled launch, just days away, "will no l
articles.content: Redemption Road's absolutely bonkers-looking medieval shooter, Kingmakers , was slated to launch in Early Access on October 8, but now its release has been pushed back with no new date in sight. The developers posted an update on Steam to say that the scheduled launch, just days away, "will no longer be possible," going on to explain that they need "a bit more time on content polish before we feel good about charging money for it." A statement posted by the developers of Kingmakers announcin

articles.description: Just a day after dethroning SpaceX as the most valuable private company in the world, OpenAI has acquired another startup. This time, the AI giant acquired Roi , an app that offers a one-stop shop for all your financial portfolios and an AI chatbot that provides personalized investing advice . Detai
articles.content: Just a day after dethroning SpaceX as the most valuable private company in the world, OpenAI has acquired another startup. This time, the AI giant acquired Roi , an app that offers a one-stop shop for all your financial portfolios and an AI chatbot that provides personalized investing advice . Details of the acquisition weren't made public, but TechCrunch reported that Sujith Vishwajith, the startup's CEO and co-founder, will be the only one joining OpenAI's team. It might come as a
articles.author: Jackson Chen

articles.title: ICE wants to build a 24/7 social media surveillance team
articles.description: ICE plans to hire contractors to scan platforms to target people for deportation.
articles.content: United States immigration authorities are moving to dramatically expand their social media surveillance , with plans to hire nearly 30 contractors to sift through posts, photos, and messagesâ€”raw material to be transformed into intelligence for deportation raids and arrests. Federal contracting records reviewed by WIRED show that the agency is seeking private vendors to run a multiyear surveillance program out of two of its little-known targeting centers. The program envisions stationing nearly 3
articles.author: Dell Cameron, WIRED.com

articles.content: Hey guys! Denis here. I am quickly passing by to thank you to the 4 maintainers that decided to put in the work and contribute to Diffium ! articles.content: A portable storage device can make a world of difference to intensive processing tasks, from running massive video games â€” which feels like all of them these days â€” to core operating system functions. articles.title: Instagram wants me to make content â€” I just want to post a photo
articles.description: Have you tried simply uploading a photo to Instagram lately? It's a minefield. Is that a Story, a Post, or a Reel? Do you want to add music? A caption? A prompt, which isâ€¦ different than a caption, somehow? How about a poll? A fundraiser? More text, but this time on top of the image? […]
articles.content: Why just post a photo when you can encourage all your friends and followers to engage with it? Have you tried simply uploading a photo to Instagram lately? It's a minefield. Is that a Story, a Post, or a Reel? Do you want to add music? A caption? A prompt, which isâ€¦ different than a caption, somehow? How about a poll? A fundraiser? More text, but this time on top of the image? Share it to Facebook? On and on and on. I have a simple request to anyone at Meta who is listening: please, just give us
articles.author: Allison Johnson

articles.description: A close examination of this year's military contracts reveals some interesting things.
articles.content: Around this time each year, the US Space Force convenes a Mission Assignment Board to dole out contracts to launch the nation's most critical national security satellites. The military announced this year's launch orders Friday, and SpaceX was the big winner. Space Systems Command, the unit responsible for awarding military launch contracts, selected SpaceX to launch five of the seven missions up for assignment this year. United Launch Alliance (ULA), a 50-50 joint venture between Boeing and Loc
articles.author: Stephen Clark

articles.title: How different mushrooms learned the same psychedelicÂ trick
articles.description: Scientists may have additional tools to produce psilocybin to use for medical purposes.
articles.content: Magic mushrooms have been used in traditional ceremonies and for recreational purposes for thousands of years. However, a new study has found that mushrooms evolved the ability to make the same psychoactive substance twice. The discovery has important implications for both our understanding of these mushroomsâ€™ role in nature and their medical potential. Magic mushrooms produce psilocybin, which your body converts into its active form, psilocin, when you ingest it. Psilocybin rose in popularity i
articles.author: Fabrizio Alberti, The Conversation

articles.content: According to new polling data , nearly 80 percent of Americans support extending Affordable Care Act (ACA) enhanced premium tax credits, which are set to expire at the end of this yearâ€”and are at the center of a funding dispute that led to a shutdown of the federal government this week. The poll, conducted by KFF and released Friday, found that 78 percent of Americans want the tax credits extended, including 92 percent of Democrats, 59 percent of Republicansâ€”and even a majority (57 percent) of R
